author: Samuel Marsden
title: Lionel Messi 'anger' led him not to celebrate Barcelona winner - Bauza
text:
"I think he reacted to the criticism he may have received after PSG," Bauza told radio show "Joga Bonito ." 
"I noticed he was very angry when he scored the goals." 
Asked why Messi had not celebrated, Luis Enrique told his postmatch news conference: "I didn't see whether he celebrated or not. And I'm not the person who has to answer that." 
Catalan newspaper Mundo Deportivo said the reaction of the fans at the weekend , rather than criticism for the Paris defeat, was the reason. Lionel Messi scored twice against Leganes but did not celebrate his second goal. 
Luis Enrique and Andre Gomes were among those whistled amid a tense atmosphere. 
Messi is in the final 18 months of his contract and his father, Jorge, is currently in Barcelona where he is reported to be negotiating a new deal with president Josep Maria Bartomeu. 
Bartomeu has told supporters he is confident that an agreement can be reached. 
Samuel Marsden covers Barcelona for ESPN FC. Follow him on Twitter @SamuelMarsden.
